bio: Stephen King is an American author of horror, supernatural fiction, suspense, and fantasy novels. His books have sold more than 350 million copies, and many have been adapted into films, television series, miniseries, and comic books.

Margaret Atwood is a Canadian poet, novelist, literary critic, essayist, teacher, environmental activist, and inventor. She is best known for her works of speculative fiction, including 'The Handmaid's Tale' and 'Oryx and Crake'.

J.K. Rowling is a British author, best known for writing the Harry Potter fantasy series. The books have won multiple awards, sold more than 500 million copies, and have been the basis for a popular film series.
James Patterson is an American author and philanthropist. He is known for his thrillers and has created enduring fictional characters such as Alex Cross, Michael Bennett, and Women's Murder Club.

Danielle Steel is an American writer, best known for her romance novels. With over 800 million copies sold, she is one of the world's best-selling authors and is best known for books such as 'The Promise' and 'Kaleidoscope'.
John Grisham is an American novelist, attorney, politician, and activist, best known for his popular legal thrillers. His books have been translated into 42 languages and published worldwide.
Nora Roberts is an American author of more than 225 romance novels. She writes as J.D. Robb for the 'In Death' series, and has also written under the pseudonyms Jill March and Sarah Hardesty.
Michael Connelly is an American author of detective novels and other crime fiction. He is best known for his series of novels featuring LAPD Detective Hieronymus 'Harry' Bosch.

Neil Gaiman is an English author of short fiction, novels, comic books, graphic novels, audio theatre, and films. He is best known for his works such as 'Coraline', 'American Gods', and 'The Sandman' series.
Paulo Coelho is a Brazilian lyricist and novelist, best known for his novel 'The Alchemist'. His works have been translated into 81 languages and sold more than 225 million copies worldwide.
Gillian Flynn is an American author, known for her novels 'Gone Girl', 'Sharp Objects', and 'Dark Places', all of which have been adapted into successful films or TV series.
Haruki Murakami is a Japanese writer known for his surreal and melancholic novels, including 'Norwegian Wood', 'Kafka on the Shore', and '1Q84'.
Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie is a Nigerian writer known for her novels 'Half of a Yellow Sun', 'Americanah', and 'Purple Hibiscus'.
Elena Ferrante is an Italian novelist, known for her 'Neapolitan Novels' series, which includes 'My Brilliant Friend' and 'The Story of a New Name'.
Brandon Sanderson is an American author of epic fantasy and science fiction, best known for his 'Mistborn' series and his work on the 'Wheel of Time' series.
Rupi Kaur is a Canadian poet, illustrator, and author, known for her collections 'Milk and Honey' and 'The Sun and Her Flowers'.
Colson Whitehead is an American novelist, known for his books 'The Underground Railroad', which won the Pulitzer Prize, and 'The Nickel Boys'.
Celeste Ng is an American author known for her novels 'Everything I Never Told You' and 'Little Fires Everywhere', which was adapted into a television series.
John Green is an American author and YouTube content creator, known for his novels 'The Fault in Our Stars' and 'Looking for Alaska'.
Tayari Jones is an American author known for her novel 'An American Marriage', which won the Women's Prize for Fiction.
David Mitchell is an English novelist known for his novels 'Cloud Atlas' and 'The Bone Clocks'.
Jennifer Egan is an American novelist and short story writer, known for her novel 'A Visit from the Goon Squad', which won the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction.
Ali Smith is a Scottish author known for her novels 'How to be both', 'Autumn', 'Winter', 'Spring', and 'Summer'.
Ocean Vuong is a Vietnamese-American poet, essayist, and novelist, known for his poetry collection 'Night Sky with Exit Wounds' and his novel 'On Earth We're Briefly Gorgeous'.
Madeline Miller is an American novelist known for her retellings of classical myths, including 'The Song of Achilles' and 'Circe'.
Rebecca Makkai is an American novelist and short story writer, known for her novels 'The Great Believers' and 'The Hundred-Year House'.
Angie Thomas is an American author known for her debut novel 'The Hate U Give', which was adapted into a successful film.
Brit Bennett is an American author known for her novels 'The Mothers' and 'The Vanishing Half'.
Roxane Gay is an American writer, professor, and commentator, known for her essay collection 'Bad Feminist' and her memoir 'Hunger'.
N.K. Jemisin is an American science fiction and fantasy writer, known for her 'Broken Earth' trilogy, which won three consecutive Hugo Awards.
Ijeoma Oluo is an American writer and speaker, known for her book 'So You Want to Talk About Race', which explores race relations in America.
Lauren Groff is an American novelist and short story writer, known for her books 'Fates and Furies' and 'Florida'.
Kevin Kwan is a Singaporean-American novelist, known for his satirical novels 'Crazy Rich Asians', 'China Rich Girlfriend', and 'Rich People Problems'.
Valeria Luiselli is a Mexican author known for her novels 'The Story of My Teeth' and 'Lost Children Archive'.
Imbolo Mbue is a Cameroonian-American author, known for her debut novel 'Behold the Dreamers', which won the PEN/Faulkner Award for Fiction.

H.N. KHAN is a Pakistani-Canadian author, known for his debut novel Wrong Side of the Court. He immigrated to Canada at age seven and grew up in Regent Park, a low-income community housing project, where the novel is set.
